code-samples.code:
curl -X POST https://api.skyvern.com/v1/workflows --header 'x-api-key: {{x-api-key}}' --header 'Content-Type: text/plain' --data-raw 'title: Contact Forms
description: Fill the contact form on the website
proxy_location: RESIDENTIAL
webhook_callback_url: https://example.com/webhook
totp_verification_url: https://example.com/totp
persist_browser_session: false
model:
  name: gpt-4.1
workflow_definition:
  parameters:
    - key: website_url
      description: null
      parameter_type: workflow
      workflow_parameter_type: string
      default_value: null
    - key: name
      description: null
      parameter_type: workflow
      workflow_parameter_type: string
      default_value: null
    - key: additional_information
      description: null
      parameter_type: workflow
      workflow_parameter_type: string
      default_value: |-
        Message: I'd love to learn more about your...
        Phone: 123-456-7890
        Inquiry type: sales
        Optional Subject: Hello from [Company Here]
    - key: email
      description: null
      parameter_type: workflow
      workflow_parameter_type: string
      default_value: null
  blocks:
    - label: Fill_Out_Contact_Form
      continue_on_failure: true
      block_type: navigation
      url: "{{website_url}}"
      title: Fill_Out_Contact_Form
      engine: skyvern-1.0
      navigation_goal: >-
        Find the contact form. Fill out the contact us form and submit it. Your
        goal is complete when the page says your message has been sent. In the
        case you can't find a contact us form, terminate.


        Fill out required fields as best you can using the following
        information:

        {{name}}

        {{email}}

        {{additional_information}}
      error_code_mapping: null
      max_retries: 0
      max_steps_per_run: null
      complete_on_download: false
      download_suffix: null
      parameter_keys: []
      totp_identifier: null
      totp_verification_url: null
      cache_actions: false
      complete_criterion: ""
      terminate_criterion: ""
      include_action_history_in_verification: false
    - label: Extract_Email
      continue_on_failure: false
      block_type: extraction
      url: ""
      title: Extract_Email
      data_extraction_goal: "Extract a company email if available "
      data_schema: null
      max_retries: 0
      max_steps_per_run: null
      parameter_keys: []
      cache_actions: false
'

from skyvern import Skyvern

# Create a workflow in JSON format
workflow_definition = {
    "title": "Contact Forms Workflow",
    "description": "Fill the contact form on the website",
    "proxy_location": "RESIDENTIAL",
    "webhook_callback_url": "https://example.com/webhook",
    "totp_verification_url": "https://example.com/totp",
    "totp_identifier": "4155555555",
    "model": {"name": "gpt-4.1"},
    "workflow_definition": {
        "parameters": [
            {
                "key": "website_url",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": None,
            },
            {
                "key": "name",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": None,
            },
            {
                "key": "additional_information",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": "Message: I'd love to learn more about your...
Phone: 123-456-7890
Inquiry type: sales
Optional Subject: Hello from [Company Here]",
            },
            {
                "key": "email",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": None,
            },
        ],
        "blocks": [
            {
                "label": "Fill_Out_Contact_Form",
                "continue_on_failure": True,
                "block_type": "navigation",
                "url": "{{website_url}}",
                "title": "Fill_Out_Contact_Form",
                "engine": "skyvern-1.0",
                "navigation_goal": "Find the contact form. Fill out the contact us form and submit it. Your goal is complete when the page says your message has been sent. In the case you can't find a contact us form, terminate.

Fill out required fields as best you can using the following information:
{{name}}
{{email}}
{{additional_information}}",
                "error_code_mapping": None,
                "max_retries": 0,
                "max_steps_per_run": None,
                "complete_on_download": False,
                "download_suffix": None,
                "parameter_keys": [],
                "totp_identifier": None,
                "totp_verification_url": None,
                "cache_actions": False,
                "complete_criterion": "",
                "terminate_criterion": "",
                "include_action_history_in_verification": False,
            },
            {
                "label": "Extract_Email",
                "continue_on_failure": False,
                "block_type": "extraction",
                "url": "",
                "title": "Extract_Email",
                "data_extraction_goal": "Extract a company email if available ",
                "data_schema": None,
                "max_retries": 0,
                "max_steps_per_run": None,
                "parameter_keys": [],
                "cache_actions": False,
            },
        ],
    },
}
skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
workflow = await skyvern.create_workflow(json_definition=workflow_definition)
print(workflow)

get.description:
Get all workflows with the latest version for the organization.

Search semantics:
- If `search_key` is provided, its value is used as a unified search term for
  `workflows.title`, `folders.title`, and workflow parameter metadata (key, description, and default_value for
  `WorkflowParameterModel`).
- Falls back to deprecated `title` (title-only search) if `search_key` is not provided.
- Parameter metadata search excludes soft-deleted parameter rows across all parameter tables.

parameters.name: search_key

schema.description: Unified search across workflow title, folder name, and parameter metadata (key, description, default_value).
schema.title: Search Key

parameters.description: Unified search across workflow title, folder name, and parameter metadata (key, description, default_value).

parameters.name: title

schema.description: Deprecated: use search_key instead.
schema.title: Title

parameters.description: Deprecated: use search_key instead.

parameters.name: folder_id

schema.description: Filter workflows by folder ID
schema.title: Folder Id

parameters.description: Filter workflows by folder ID

schema.title: X-Api-Key

from skyvern import Skyvern

updated_workflow_definition = {
    "title": "Updated Contact Forms Workflow",
    "description": "Fill the contact form on the website",
    "proxy_location": "RESIDENTIAL",
    "webhook_callback_url": "https://example.com/webhook",
    "totp_verification_url": "https://example.com/totp",
    "totp_identifier": "4155555555",
    "model": {"name": "gpt-4.1"},
    "workflow_definition": {
        "parameters": [
            {
                "key": "website_url",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": None,
            },
            {
                "key": "name",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": None,
            },
            {
                "key": "additional_information",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": "Message: I'd love to learn more about your...
Phone: 123-456-7890
Inquiry type: sales
Optional Subject: Hello from [Company Here]",
            },
            {
                "key": "email",
                "description": None,
                "parameter_type": "workflow",
                "workflow_parameter_type": "string",
                "default_value": None,
            },
        ],
        "blocks": [
            {
                "label": "Fill_Out_Contact_Form",
                "continue_on_failure": True,
                "block_type": "navigation",
                "url": "{{website_url}}",
                "title": "Fill_Out_Contact_Form",
                "engine": "skyvern-1.0",
                "navigation_goal": "Find the contact form. Fill out the contact us form and submit it. Your goal is complete when the page says your message has been sent. In the case you can't find a contact us form, terminate.

Fill out required fields as best you can using the following information:
{{name}}
{{email}}
{{additional_information}}",
                "error_code_mapping": None,
                "max_retries": 0,
                "max_steps_per_run": None,
                "complete_on_download": False,
                "download_suffix": None,
                "parameter_keys": [],
                "totp_identifier": None,
                "totp_verification_url": None,
                "cache_actions": False,
                "complete_criterion": "",
                "terminate_criterion": "",
                "include_action_history_in_verification": False,
            },
            {
                "label": "Extract_Email",
                "continue_on_failure": False,
                "block_type": "extraction",
                "url": "",
                "title": "Extract_Email",
                "data_extraction_goal": "Extract a company email if available ",
                "data_schema": None,
                "max_retries": 0,
                "max_steps_per_run": None,
                "parameter_keys": [],
                "cache_actions": False,
            },
        ],
    },
}
skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
workflow = await skyvern.update_workflow(workflow_id="wpid_123", json_definition=updated_workflow_definition)
print(workflow)

print(timeline)

# Get timeline for a task_v2 run
timeline = await skyvern.get_run_timeline(run_id="tsk_v2_123")
print(timeline)

browser_session = await skyvern.get_browser_session(browser_session_id="pbs_123")
print(browser_session)

post.description: Forward a TOTP (2FA, MFA) email or sms message containing the code to Skyvern. This endpoint stores the code in database so that Skyvern can use it while running tasks/workflows.

parameters.name: x-api-key

schema.description: Skyvern API key for authentication. API key can be found at https://app.skyvern.com/settings.
schema.title: X-Api-Key

parameters.description: Skyvern API key for authentication. API key can be found at https://app.skyvern.com/settings.

code-samples.code:
from skyvern import Skyvern

skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
await skyvern.send_totp_code(
    totp_identifier="john.doe@example.com",
    content="Hello, your verification code is 123456"
)

from skyvern import Skyvern

skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
await skyvern.create_credential(
    name="My Credential",
    credential_type="password",
    credential={"username": "username", "password": "password"},
)

from skyvern import Skyvern

skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
await skyvern.create_credential(
    name="My Credit Card",
    credential_type="credit_card",
    credential={
        "card_number": "4242424242424242",
        "card_cvv": "424",
        "card_exp_month": "12",
        "card_exp_year": "2028",
        "card_brand": "visa",
        "card_holder_name": "John Doe",
    },
)

post.description: Log in to a website using either credential stored in Skyvern, Bitwarden, 1Password, or Azure Vault

parameters.name: x-api-key

schema.description: Skyvern API key for authentication. API key can be found at https://app.skyvern.com/settings.
schema.title: X-Api-Key

parameters.description: Skyvern API key for authentication. API key can be found at https://app.skyvern.com/settings.

code-samples.code:
# Login with password saved in Skyvern
from skyvern import Skyvern

skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
await skyvern.login(
    url="https://example.com",
    credential_type="skyvern",
    credential_id="cred_123"),
)

# Login with password saved in Bitwarden
from skyvern import Skyvern

skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
# Login with a Bitwarden collection and website url filter
await skyvern.login(
    url="https://example.com",
    credential_type="bitwarden",
    bitwarden_collection_id="BITWARDEN COLLECTION ID",
)

# Login with a Bitwarden item
await skyvern.login(
    url="https://example.com",
    credential_type="bitwarden",
    bitwarden_item_id="BITWARDEN ITEM ID",
)

# Login with password saved in 1Password
from skyvern import Skyvern

skyvern = Skyvern(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
await skyvern.login(
    url="https://example.com",
    credential_type="onepassword",
    onepassword_vault_id="1PASSWORD VAULT ID",
    onepassword_item_id="1PASSWORD ITEM ID",
)

browser_session_id.title: Browser Session Id
browser_session_id.description: Unique identifier for the browser session. browser_session_id starts with `pbs_`.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: ID of the organization that owns this session

runnable_type.title: Runnable Type
runnable_type.description: Type of the current runnable associated with this session (workflow, task etc)

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Timeout in minutes for the session. Timeout is applied after the session is started. Defaults to 60 minutes.

browser_address.title: Browser Address
browser_address.description: Url for connecting to the browser

app_url.title: App Url
app_url.description: Url for the browser session page

vnc_streaming_supported.title: Vnc Streaming Supported
vnc_streaming_supported.description: Whether the browser session supports VNC streaming

download_path.title: Download Path
download_path.description: The path where the browser session downloads files

downloaded_files.title: Downloaded Files
downloaded_files.description: The list of files downloaded by the browser session

recordings.title: Recordings
recordings.description: The list of video recordings from the browser session

started_at.title: Started At
started_at.description: Timestamp when the session was started

completed_at.title: Completed At
completed_at.description: Timestamp when the session was completed

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Timestamp when the session was created (the timestamp for the initial request)

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Timestamp when the session was last modified

deleted_at.title: Deleted At
deleted_at.description: Timestamp when the session was deleted, if applicable

BrowserSessionResponse.title: BrowserSessionResponse
BrowserSessionResponse.description: Response model for browser session information.

intention.title: Intention
intention.description: The intention or goal of the click

browser_session_id.title: Browser Session Id
browser_session_id.description: Persistent browser session to convert into a profile

workflow_run_id.title: Workflow Run Id
workflow_run_id.description: Workflow run whose persisted session should be captured

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Timeout in minutes for the session. Timeout is applied after the session is started. Must be between 5 and 1440. Defaults to 60.

proxy_location.description:
Geographic Proxy location to route the browser traffic through. This is only available in Skyvern Cloud.

Available geotargeting options:
- RESIDENTIAL: the default value. Skyvern Cloud uses a random US residential proxy.
- RESIDENTIAL_ES: Spain
- RESIDENTIAL_IE: Ireland
- RESIDENTIAL_GB: United Kingdom
- RESIDENTIAL_IN: India
- RESIDENTIAL_JP: Japan
- RESIDENTIAL_FR: France
- RESIDENTIAL_DE: Germany
- RESIDENTIAL_NZ: New Zealand
- RESIDENTIAL_ZA: South Africa
- RESIDENTIAL_AR: Argentina
- RESIDENTIAL_AU: Australia
- RESIDENTIAL_ISP: ISP proxy
- US-CA: California
- US-NY: New York
- US-TX: Texas
- US-FL: Florida
- US-WA: Washington
- NONE: No proxy

subject.title: Subject
subject.default: Human interaction required for workflow run

body.title: Body
body.default: Your interaction is required for a workflow run!

HumanInteractionBlock.title: HumanInteractionBlock
HumanInteractionBlock.description:
A block for human/agent interaction.

For the first pass at this, the implicit behaviour is that the user is given a single binary
choice (a go//no-go).

If the human:
  - chooses positively, the workflow continues
  - chooses negatively, the workflow is terminated
  - does not respond within the timeout period, the workflow terminates

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.default: Please review and approve or reject to continue the workflow.

error.title: Error

improved.title: Improved

credential_type.description: Where to get the credential from

script_revision_id.description: Unique identifier for this specific script revision

organization_id.title: Organization Id

modified_at.title: Modified At

path.title: Path

ScriptFileCreate.title: ScriptFileCreate

intention.title: Intention
intention.description: The intention or goal of the selection

totp_identifier.title: Totp Identifier
totp_identifier.description: The identifier of the TOTP code. It can be the email address, phone number, or the identifier of the user.

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: The task_id the totp code is for. It can be the task_id of the task that the TOTP code is for.

workflow_id.title: Workflow Id
workflow_id.description: The workflow ID the TOTP code is for. It can be the workflow ID of the workflow that the TOTP code is for.

workflow_run_id.title: Workflow Run Id
workflow_run_id.description: The workflow run id that the TOTP code is for. It can be the workflow run id of the workflow run that the TOTP code is for.

source.title: Source
source.description: An optional field. The source of the TOTP code. e.g. email, sms, etc.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the TOTP code. It can be the email content that contains the TOTP code, or the sms message that contains the TOTP code. Skyvern will automatically extract the TOTP code from the content.

expired_at.title: Expired At
expired_at.description: The timestamp when the TOTP code expires

totp_code_id.title: Totp Code Id
totp_code_id.description: The skyvern ID of the TOTP code.

code.title: Code
code.description: The TOTP code extracted from the content.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The ID of the organization that the TOTP code is for.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp when the TOTP code was created.

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: The timestamp when the TOTP code was modified.

otp_type.description: The type of the OTP code.

totp_identifier.title: Totp Identifier
totp_identifier.description: The identifier of the TOTP code. It can be the email address, phone number, or the identifier of the user.

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: The task_id the totp code is for. It can be the task_id of the task that the TOTP code is for.

workflow_id.title: Workflow Id
workflow_id.description: The workflow ID the TOTP code is for. It can be the workflow ID of the workflow that the TOTP code is for.

workflow_run_id.title: Workflow Run Id
workflow_run_id.description: The workflow run id that the TOTP code is for. It can be the workflow run id of the workflow run that the TOTP code is for.

source.title: Source
source.description: An optional field. The source of the TOTP code. e.g. email, sms, etc.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the TOTP code. It can be the email content that contains the TOTP code, or the sms message that contains the TOTP code. Skyvern will automatically extract the TOTP code from the content.

expired_at.title: Expired At
expired_at.description: The timestamp when the TOTP code expires

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The goal or task description for Skyvern to accomplish
examples: Find the top 3 posts on Hacker News.
Go to google finance, extract the "AAPL" stock price for me with the date.

url.title: Url
url.description: The starting URL for the task. If not provided, Skyvern will attempt to determine an appropriate URL

engine.description: The engine that powers the agent task. The default value is `skyvern-2.0`, the latest Skyvern agent that performs pretty well with complex and multi-step tasks. `skyvern-1.0` is good for simple tasks like filling a form, or searching for information on Google. The `openai-cua` engine uses OpenAI's CUA model. The `anthropic-cua` uses Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 3.7 model with the computer use tool.

title.title: Title
examples: The title of my first skyvern task

proxy_location.description:
Geographic Proxy location to route the browser traffic through. This is only available in Skyvern Cloud.

Available geotargeting options:
- RESIDENTIAL: the default value. Skyvern Cloud uses a random US residential proxy.
- RESIDENTIAL_ES: Spain
- RESIDENTIAL_IE: Ireland
- RESIDENTIAL_GB: United Kingdom
- RESIDENTIAL_IN: India
- RESIDENTIAL_JP: Japan
- RESIDENTIAL_FR: France
- RESIDENTIAL_DE: Germany
- RESIDENTIAL_NZ: New Zealand
- RESIDENTIAL_ZA: South Africa
- RESIDENTIAL_AR: Argentina
- RESIDENTIAL_AU: Australia
- RESIDENTIAL_ISP: ISP proxy
- US-CA: California
- US-NY: New York
- US-TX: Texas
- US-FL: Florida
- US-WA: Washington
- NONE: No proxy

data_extraction_schema.title: Data Extraction Schema
data_extraction_schema.description: The schema for data to be extracted from the webpage. If you're looking for consistent data schema being returned by the agent, it's highly recommended to use https://json-schema.org/.

error_code_mapping.title: Error Code Mapping
error_code_mapping.description: Custom mapping of error codes to error messages if Skyvern encounters an error.

examples.login_failed: The login credentials are incorrect or the account is locked

examples.maintenance_mode: The website is down for maintenance

max_steps.title: Max Steps
max_steps.description: Maximum number of steps the task can take. Task will fail if it exceeds this number. Cautions: you are charged per step so please set this number to a reasonable value. Contact sales@skyvern.com for custom pricing.

webhook_url.title: Webhook Url
webhook_url.description: After a run is finished, send an update to this URL. Refer to https://www.skyvern.com/docs/running-tasks/webhooks-faq for more details.

totp_identifier.title: Totp Identifier
totp_identifier.description: Identifier for the TOTP/2FA/MFA code when the code is pushed to Skyvern. Refer to https://www.skyvern.com/docs/credentials/totp#option-3-push-code-to-skyvern for more details.

totp_url.title: Totp Url
totp_url.description: URL that serves TOTP/2FA/MFA codes for Skyvern to use during the workflow run. Refer to https://www.skyvern.com/docs/credentials/totp#option-2-get-code-from-your-endpoint for more details.

browser_session_id.title: Browser Session Id
browser_session_id.description: Run the task or workflow in the specific Skyvern browser session. Having a browser session can persist the real-time state of the browser, so that the next run can continue from where the previous run left off.

extra_http_headers.title: Extra Http Headers
extra_http_headers.description: The extra HTTP headers for the requests in browser.

publish_workflow.title: Publish Workflow
publish_workflow.description: Whether to publish this task as a reusable workflow. Only available for skyvern-2.0.

include_action_history_in_verification.title: Include Action History In Verification
include_action_history_in_verification.description: Whether to include action history when verifying that the task is complete

max_screenshot_scrolls.title: Max Screenshot Scrolls
max_screenshot_scrolls.description: The maximum number of scrolls for the post action screenshot. When it's None or 0, it takes the current viewpoint screenshot.

browser_address.title: Browser Address
browser_address.description: The CDP address for the task.

run_id.title: Run Id
run_id.description: Unique identifier for this run. Run ID starts with `tsk_` for task runs and `wr_` for workflow runs.

output.title: Output
output.description: Output data from the run, if any. Format/schema depends on the data extracted by the run.

downloaded_files.title: Downloaded Files
downloaded_files.description: List of files downloaded during the run

recording_url.title: Recording Url
recording_url.description: URL to the recording of the run

screenshot_urls.title: Screenshot Urls
screenshot_urls.description: List of last n screenshot URLs in reverse chronological order - the first one the list is the latest screenshot.

failure_reason.title: Failure Reason
failure_reason.description: Reason for failure if the run failed or terminated

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Timestamp when this run was created

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Timestamp when this run was last modified

queued_at.title: Queued At
queued_at.description: Timestamp when this run was queued

started_at.title: Started At
started_at.description: Timestamp when this run started execution

app_url.title: App Url
app_url.description: URL to the application UI where the run can be viewed

browser_session_id.title: Browser Session Id
browser_session_id.description: ID of the Skyvern persistent browser session used for this run

browser_profile_id.title: Browser Profile Id
browser_profile_id.description: ID of the browser profile used for this run

max_screenshot_scrolls.title: Max Screenshot Scrolls
max_screenshot_scrolls.description: The maximum number of scrolls for the post action screenshot. When it's None or 0, it takes the current viewpoint screenshot

run_type.title: Run Type
run_type.description: Types of a task run - task_v1, task_v2, openai_cua, anthropic_cua, ui_tars

run_request.description: The original request parameters used to start this task run

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: Folder ID to assign workflow to. Set to null to remove from folder.

UpdateWorkflowFolderRequest.title: UpdateWorkflowFolderRequest
UpdateWorkflowFolderRequest.description: Request model for updating a workflow's folder assignment

intention.title: Intention
intention.description: The intention or goal of the upload

workflow_id.title: Workflow Id
workflow_id.description: ID of the workflow to run. Workflow ID starts with `wpid_`.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass to the workflow

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for this workflow run

proxy_location.description:
Geographic Proxy location to route the browser traffic through. This is only available in Skyvern Cloud.

Available geotargeting options:
- RESIDENTIAL: the default value. Skyvern Cloud uses a random US residential proxy.
- RESIDENTIAL_ES: Spain
- RESIDENTIAL_IE: Ireland
- RESIDENTIAL_GB: United Kingdom
- RESIDENTIAL_IN: India
- RESIDENTIAL_JP: Japan
- RESIDENTIAL_FR: France
- RESIDENTIAL_DE: Germany
- RESIDENTIAL_NZ: New Zealand
- RESIDENTIAL_ZA: South Africa
- RESIDENTIAL_AR: Argentina
- RESIDENTIAL_AU: Australia
- RESIDENTIAL_ISP: ISP proxy
- US-CA: California
- US-NY: New York
- US-TX: Texas
- US-FL: Florida
- US-WA: Washington
- NONE: No proxy

webhook_url.title: Webhook Url
webhook_url.description: URL to send workflow status updates to after a run is finished. Refer to https://www.skyvern.com/docs/running-tasks/webhooks-faq for webhook questions.

totp_url.title: Totp Url
totp_url.description: URL that serves TOTP/2FA/MFA codes for Skyvern to use during the workflow run. Refer to https://www.skyvern.com/docs/credentials/totp#option-2-get-code-from-your-endpoint for more details.

totp_identifier.title: Totp Identifier
totp_identifier.description: Identifier for the TOTP/2FA/MFA code when the code is pushed to Skyvern. Refer to https://www.skyvern.com/docs/credentials/totp#option-3-push-code-to-skyvern for more details.

browser_session_id.title: Browser Session Id
browser_session_id.description: ID of a Skyvern browser session to reuse, having it continue from the current screen state

browser_profile_id.title: Browser Profile Id
browser_profile_id.description: ID of a browser profile to reuse for this workflow run

max_screenshot_scrolls.title: Max Screenshot Scrolls
max_screenshot_scrolls.description: The maximum number of scrolls for the post action screenshot. When it's None or 0, it takes the current viewpoint screenshot.

extra_http_headers.title: Extra Http Headers
extra_http_headers.description: The extra HTTP headers for the requests in browser.

browser_address.title: Browser Address
browser_address.description: The CDP address for the workflow run.

ai_fallback.title: Ai Fallback
ai_fallback.description: Whether to fallback to AI if the workflow run fails.

run_with.title: Run With
run_with.description: Whether to run the workflow with agent or code.

run_id.description: Unique identifier for this run. Run ID starts with `tsk_` for task runs and `wr_` for workflow runs.

output.title: Output
output.description: Output data from the run, if any. Format/schema depends on the data extracted by the run.

downloaded_files.title: Downloaded Files
downloaded_files.description: List of files downloaded during the run

recording_url.description: URL to the recording of the run

screenshot_urls.description: List of last n screenshot URLs in reverse chronological order - the first one the list is the latest screenshot.

failure_reason.description: Reason for failure if the run failed or terminated

created_at.description: Timestamp when this run was created

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Timestamp when this run was last modified

queued_at.description: Timestamp when this run was queued

started_at.description: Timestamp when this run started execution

max_screenshot_scrolls.description: The maximum number of scrolls for the post action screenshot. When it's None or 0, it takes the current viewpoint screenshot

run_type.title: Run Type
run_type.description: Type of run - always workflow_run for workflow runs

run_with.title: Run With
run_with.description: Whether the workflow run was executed with agent or code

ai_fallback.title: Ai Fallback
ai_fallback.description: Whether to fallback to AI if code run fails.

skyvern__forge__sdk__schemas__credential.description: Type of credential stored in the system.
